description.narrative: (USAID Central Africa Regional): FY 2017 resources will directly support biodiversity conservation in the 6.8 million hectare Maiko-Tayna-Kahuzi Biega landscape. The program will mitigate threats to biodiversity by improving protected area management, establishing community nature reserves, enforcing wildlife laws, combating wildlife poaching and trafficking, and expanding economic incentives for conservation. .USAID will use focused Sustainable Landscapes funds to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from deforestation and forest degradation and enhance carbon sequestration by supporting implementation of the national Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation strategy and action plan, as well as by supporting sustainable forest management. Biodiversity funds will indirectly support sustainable landscapes objectives by slowing deforestation and forest degradation. The benefitting country is the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
